alert.note: Alert for Hamblen (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 26 at 8:24AM CDT until August 26 at 9:30AM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 AM EDT THIS MORNING FOR CENTRAL HAMBLEN COUNTY... At 924 AM EDT, law enforcement and the public reported heavy rain caused by thunderstorms. Multiple roads are likely impassible, especially in the Morristown vicinity. Between 3 and 4.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Public and law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Morristown, Bean Station, Russellville and Lowland. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
